fields.name: business
fields.description: Load information about a specific business.

args.name: id
args.description: The Yelp ID for the business you want to load.

fields.name: business_match
fields.description: Match detailed business location data to businesses on Yelp.

args.name: name
args.description: Required. The name of the business. Maximum length is 64; only digits, letters, spaces, and !#$%&+,­./:?@'are allowed.

args.name: address1
args.description:
Required. The first line of the business’s address. Maximum length is 64;
only digits, letters, spaces, and ­’/#&,.: are allowed. Note that the empty
string  is allowed; this will specifically match certain service businesses
that have no street address.

args.name: address2
args.description:
Optional. The second line of the business’s address. Maximum length is 64;
only digits, letters, spaces, and ­’/#&,.: are allowed.

args.name: address3
args.description:
Optional. The third line of the business’s address. Maximum length is 64;
only digits, letters, spaces, and ­’/#&,.: are allowed.

args.name: city
args.description: Required. The city of the business. Maximum length is 64; only digits, letters, spaces, and ­’.() are allowed.

args.name: state
args.description: Required. The ISO 3166­-2 code for the region/province of the business. Maximum length is 3.

args.name: country
args.description: Required. The ISO 3166­-1 alpha­2 country code of the business. Maximum length is 2.

args.name: latitude
args.description: Optional. The WGS84 latitude of the business in decimal degrees. Must be between ­-90 and +90.

args.name: longitude
args.description: Optional. The WGS84 longitude of the business in decimal degrees. Must be between ­-180 and +180.

args.name: phone
args.description:
Optional. The phone number of the business which can be submitted as (a)
locally ­formatted with digits only (e.g., 016703080) or (b)
internationally­ formatted with a leading + sign and digits only after
(+35316703080). Maximum length is 32.

args.name: postal_code
args.description: Optional. The postal code of the business. Maximum length is 12.

args.name: limit
args.description: Optional. The maximum number of businesses to return.

args.name: match_threshold
args.description:
Optional. A match quality threshold that will determine how closely
businesses must match the input to be returned. Defaults to DEFAULT.

fields.name: reviews
fields.description: Load reviews for a specific business.

args.name: business
args.description: The Yelp ID for the business you want to load.

args.name: locale
args.description: Output locale.  Show reviews in the same language. See the list of supported locales.

fields.name: phone_search
fields.description: Search for businesses on Yelp by their phone number.

args.name: phone
args.description:
Required. Phone number of the business you want to search for. It must start
with + and include the country code, like +14159083801.

fields.name: search
fields.description: Search for businesses on Yelp.

args.name: term
args.description:
Optional. Search term (e.g. "food", "restaurants"). If term isn't included
we search everything. The term keyword also accepts business names such as "Starbucks".

args.name: location
args.description:
Required. Specifies the combination of "address, neighborhood, city, state
or zip, optional country" to be used when searching for businesses.

args.name: offset
args.description: Optional. Offset the list of returned business results by this amount.

args.name: limit
args.description: Optional. Number of business results to return. By default, it will return 20. Maximum is 50.

args.name: sort_by
args.description:
Sort the results by one of the these modes: best_match, rating, review_count
or distance. By default it's best_match. The rating sort is not strictly
sorted by the rating value, but by an adjusted rating value that takes into
account the number of ratings, similar to a Bayesian average. This is so a
business with 1 rating of 5 stars doesn't immediately jump to the top.

args.name: locale
args.description: Optional. Specify the locale to return the event information in. See the list of supported locales.

args.name: longitude
args.description: Required if location is not provided. Longitude of the location you want to search nearby.

args.name: latitude
args.description: Required if location is not provided. Latitude of the location you want to search nearby.

args.name: categories
args.description:
Optional. Categories to filter the search results with. See the list of
supported categories. The category filter can be a list of comma delimited
categories. For example, "bars,french" will filter by Bars OR French. The
category identifier should be used (for example "discgolf", not "Disc Golf").

args.name: open_now
args.description:
Optional. Default to false. When set to true, only return the businesses
open now. Notice that open_at and open_now cannot be used together.

args.name: open_at
args.description:
Optional. An integer representing the Unix time in the same timezone of the
search location. If specified, it will return business open at the given
time. Notice that open_at and open_now cannot be used together.

args.name: price
args.description:
Optional. Pricing levels to filter the search result with: 1 = $, 2 = $$, 3
= $$$, 4 = $$$$. The price filter can be a list of comma delimited pricing
levels. For example, "1, 2, 3" will filter the results to show the ones that
are $, $$, or $$$.

args.name: attributes
args.description: Additional filters to restrict search results.

args.name: radius
args.description:
Optional. Search radius in meters. If the value is too large, a
AREA_TOO_LARGE error may be returned. The max value is 40000 meters (25 miles).

fields.name: event
fields.description: Load information about a specific event.

args.name: id
args.description: The Yelp ID for the event you want to load.

fields.name: event_search
fields.description: Search for events based on search parameters.

args.name: locale
args.description: Optional. Specify the locale to return the event information in. See the list of supported locales.

args.name: offset
args.description: Optional. Offset the list of returned events results by this amount.

args.name: limit
args.description: Optional. Number of events results to return. By default, it will return 3. Maximum is 50.

args.name: sort_by
args.description: Optional. Sort by either descending or ascending order. By default, it returns results in descending order.

args.name: sort_on
args.description: Optional. Sort on popularity or time start. By default, sorts on popularity.

args.name: start_date
args.description: Optional. Unix timestamp of the event start time. Will return events that only begin at or after the specified time.

args.name: end_date
args.description: Optional. Unix timestamp of the event end time. Will return events that only end at or before the specified time.

args.name: categories
args.description:
Optional. The category filter can be a list of comma delimited categories to
get OR'd results that include the categories provided. See the list of categories.

args.name: is_free
args.description:
Optional. Filter whether the events are free to attend. By default no filter
is applied so both free and paid events will be returned.

args.name: location
args.description:
Optional. Specifies the combination of "address, neighborhood, city, state
or zip, optional country" to be used when searching for events.

args.name: latitude
args.description: Optional. Latitude of the location you want to search nearby. If latitude is provided, longitude is required too.

args.name: longitude
args.description: Optional. Longitude of the location you want to search nearby. If longitude is provided, latitude is required too.

args.name: radius
args.description:
Optional. Search radius in meters. If the value is too large, a
AREA_TOO_LARGE error may be returned. The max value is 40000 meters (25 miles).

args.name: alias
args.description: Optional. Alias of the category to search for. If alias is provided, up to one result will be returned.

args.name: country
args.description: Optional. Country code used to filter categories available in a given country.

args.name: locale
args.description: Optional. Locale used to localize the title of the category. By default, this is set to en_US.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of this business.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Yelp ID of this business.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Yelp alias of this business.

fields.name: is_claimed
fields.description: Whether business has been claimed by a business owner.

fields.name: is_closed
fields.description: Whether business has been (permanently) closed.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL for business page on Yelp.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Phone number of the business.

fields.name: display_phone
fields.description:
Phone number of the business formatted nicely to be displayed to users. The
format is the standard phone number format for the business's country.

fields.name: review_count
fields.description: Number of reviews for this business.

fields.name: categories
fields.description: A list of category title and alias pairs associated with this business.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: Rating for this business (value ranges from 1, 1.5, ... 4.5, 5).

fields.name: price
fields.description:
Price level of the business. Value is one of $, $$, $$$ and $$$$ or null if we
don't have price available for the business.

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location of this business, including address, city, state, postal code and country.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: The coordinates of this business.

fields.name: photos
fields.description: URLs of up to three photos of the business.

fields.name: hours
fields.description: Opening hours of the business.

fields.name: special_hours
fields.description: Special hours of the business, these override regular opening hours of the business.

fields.name: reviews
fields.description: Review snippets from the business.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: When searching, this provides the distance of the business from the search location in meters

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Business attributes.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: Information and action links for transacting with this business online.

fields.name: messaging
fields.description: Information and action links for messaging with this business via Yelp, including requesting quotes.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of a category for display purposes.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: Alias of a category, when searching for business in certain categories, use alias rather than the title.

fields.name: parent_categories
fields.description: List of parent categories.

fields.name: country_whitelist
fields.description: Countries for which this category is whitelisted.

fields.name: country_blacklist
fields.description: Countries for which this category is blacklisted.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for this country.

fields.name: locales
fields.description: Supported locales with this country.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The code for this locale, in the format of {language_code}_{country_code}.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language component of this locale.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The country component of this locale.

fields.name: code
fields.description:
The ISO 639-1 alpha-2 code for this language. When such a code is unavailable
for a language, it will be a ISO 639-2 alpha-3 code instead.

fields.name: locales
fields.description: Supported locales with this language.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: address1
fields.description: Street address of this business.

fields.name: address2
fields.description: Street address of this business, continued.

fields.name: address3
fields.description: Street address of this business, continued.

fields.name: city
fields.description: City of this business.

fields.name: state
fields.description: ISO 3166-2 (with a few exceptions) state code of this business.

fields.name: postal_code
fields.description: Postal code of this business.

fields.name: country
fields.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of this business.

fields.name: formatted_address
fields.description:
Array of strings that if organized vertically give an address that is in the
standard address format for the business's country.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: The latitude of this business.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: The longitude of this business.

fields.name: hours_type
fields.description: The type of the opening hours information. Right now, this is always REGULAR.

fields.name: open
fields.description: The specific open hours and days for a business.

fields.name: is_open_now
fields.description: Describes if the business is open now.

fields.name: is_overnight
fields.description: Whether the business opens overnight or not. When this is true, the end time will be lower than the start time.

fields.name: end
fields.description: End of the opening hours in a day, in 24-hour clock notation, like 2130 means 9:30 PM.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Start of the opening hours in a day, in 24-hour clock notation, like 1000 means 10 AM.

fields.name: day
fields.description:
From 0 to 6, representing day of the week from Monday to Sunday. Notice that
you may get the same day of the week more than once if the business has more
than one opening time slots.

fields.name: is_overnight
fields.description: Whether the business opens overnight or not. When this is true, the end time will be lower than the start time.

fields.name: is_closed
fields.description: Whether the business is closed on the indicated date.

fields.name: end
fields.description: End of the opening hours in a day, in 24-hour clock notation, like 2130 means 9:30 PM.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Start of the opening hours in a day, in 24-hour clock notation, like 1000 means 10 AM.

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date for which the special hours apply inISO8601 format, AKA YYYY-MM-DD

types.name: Date
types.description:
The `Date` scalar type represents a Date
value as specified by
[iso8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Yelp ID of this review.

fields.name: rating
fields.description: Rating of this review.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user who wrote the review.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text excerpt of this review.

fields.name: time_created
fields.description: The time that the review was created in PST.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of this review.

fields.name: public_response
fields.description: Details about the publicly visible response to this review posted by the business owner.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The User's ID, a 22 character string

fields.name: profile_url
fields.description: User's profile url

fields.name: image_url
fields.description: URL of the user's profile photo.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the user.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text of this public review response.

fields.name: time_created
fields.description: The time that this public review response was created in ISO8601 format.

fields.name: business_user
fields.description: Details about business user associated with the business who posted this public review response comment.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime
value as specified by
[iso8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the business user.

fields.name: role
fields.description: Business role for the business user.

fields.name: photo_url
fields.description: URL of the business user's profile photo.

fields.name: gender_neutral_restrooms
fields.description:
Whether business has gender neutral restrooms. See https://www.yelpblog.com/2017/06/find-gender-neutral-restrooms-160000-businesses-yelp
for more details.

fields.name: open_to_all
fields.description:
Whether business has opted in to the "Open to All" pledge. See
https://www.yelpblog.com/2018/07/opentoall for more details.

fields.name: wheelchair_accessible
fields.description: Whether business is wheelchair accessible.

fields.name: name_code
fields.description: The machine-friendly name of this business attribute.

fields.name: value_code
fields.description: The machine-friendly value of this business attribute.

fields.name: restaurant_reservations
fields.description: Online reservations via Yelp Reservations.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Visit this action link URL to go directly into the Yelp Reservations flow for this business.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Visit this action link URL to go directly into the business messaging flow for this business.

fields.name: use_case_text
fields.description: The localized text description of the type of messaging this business is enabled for. Example: "Request a Quote"

fields.name: business
fields.description: A list of business Yelp finds based on the search criteria.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of businesses found.

fields.name: review
fields.description: The reviews objects.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of reviews.

fields.name: possible_languages
fields.description: A list of languages for which the business has at least one review.

fields.name: business
fields.description: The business associated with the reviews

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of this event.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Event id.

fields.name: business
fields.description: The business tied to this event.

fields.name: business_id
fields.description: The ID of the related business.

fields.name: attending_count
fields.description: Number of Yelp users attending this event.

fields.name: category
fields.description: The category of this event.

fields.name: cost
fields.description: Cost of attending this event.

fields.name: cost_max
fields.description: Maximum cost of this event.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description excerpt of this event.

fields.name: event_site_url
fields.description: Yelp page of this event.

fields.name: image_url
fields.description: Yelp image url of this event.

fields.name: interested_count
fields.description: Number of Yelp users interested in attending this event.

fields.name: is_canceled
fields.description: Whether this event is canceled.

fields.name: is_free
fields.description: Whether this event is free.

fields.name: is_official
fields.description: Whether this event is created by a Yelp community manager.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude of this event.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude of this event.

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location of this business, including address, city, state, postal code and country.

fields.name: tickets_url
fields.description: URL to buy tickets for this event.

fields.name: time_end
fields.description: Time this event ends. Returns time and date in the following format - "YYYY-MM-DD HH-mm".

fields.name: time_start
fields.description: Time the event starts. Returns time and date in the following format - "YYYY-MM-DD HH-mm".

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of events found matching search criteria.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of events found.

fields.name: category
fields.description: The category objects.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of categories.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: client
directives.description: Direct the client to resolve this field locally, either from the cache or local resolvers.

args.name: always
args.description:
When true, the client will never use the cache for this value. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#forcing-resolvers-with-clientalways-true

directives.name: export
directives.description:
Export this locally resolved field as a variable to be used in the remainder of this query. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/essentials/local-state/#using-client-fields-as-variables

args.name: as
args.description: The variable name to export this field as.

directives.name: connection
directives.description:
Specify a custom store key for this result. See
https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/advanced/caching/#the-connection-directive

args.name: key
args.description: Specify the store key.

args.name: filter
args.description: An array of query argument names to include in the generated custom store key.
